Customer Advisory Board 
Day 2 recap

The second and final day of LINDEMANN‚Äôs Customer Advisory Board built on the momentum of an incredible first day, with deeper discussions, industry-leading insights, and an exclusive look at cutting-edge recycling technology in action. Steel industry expert Dr. Christian Fr√∂hling from SMS took centre stage with a keynote exploring the role of electric arc furnaces, regulatory pressures, and the role recycled steel/scrap will play in the developing global demand for green steel.üå±

His insights reinforced the industry‚Äôs need for improved density and purity ‚Äì as well as innovation, collaboration and a strong commitment to decarbonization.
Attendees then had the unique opportunity to tour S. Norton Group‚Äôs advanced recycling facility, featuring the world‚Äôs first LINDEMANN shredder with the revolutionary Variable Frequency Drive (VDA) technology, as well as Shredder Drive Assist (SDA). Seeing innovation in action capped off an event that was not just about discussion ‚Äî but about real solutions and a better way forward for the industry.‚ôªÔ∏è

From thought-provoking keynotes to hands-on experiences, LINDEMANN‚Äôs Customer Advisory Board was a milestone moment for the industry. This event underscored the power of partnership in shaping a stronger, more sustainable future for metal recycling.

It was a pleasure to have you on board üòéI was honoured to be asked by Lindemann to be keynote speaker at their Customer Advisory Board meeting in Manchester. The meeting was attended by the CEOs and owners of leading metal recycling companies from across the globe. Attendees travelled from North America, France, Belgium, Holland, Germany, Spain, Sweden, Norway, Czech Republic and Denmark. We discussed the challenges facing the metal recycling industry and the solutions to overcome those challenges. To engage and interact with the decision makers at the top of their respective companies was extremely productive. The conclusion for our industry is that the outlook is extremely positive.
On a personal note the icing on the cake was winning the table tennis competition where I managed to take a point off professional German table tennis player Timo Boll former World Number 1, Olympic Silver Medalist, European and World Champion. Those years away at boarding school playing endless games of table tennis eventually paid off! 
A special thankyou to Matt Norton from #SNorton for hosting the event and organising a visit to S Norton‚Äôs outstanding metal recycling operation in Trafford Park Manchester.

First Customer Advisory Board of Metal Recycling Industry successfully 
held in Manchester

Day 1 recap

Industry leaders, innovators, and decision-makers from across the global metal recycling sector gathered at the historic Midland Hotel in Manchester, England for LINDEMANN‚Äôs inaugural Customer Advisory Board (CAB). Over two days, delegates from all over Europe ‚Äì and as far afield as Canada ‚Äì discussed the future of metal recycling, emerging trends, challenges, and how the industry can drive meaningful change.

Following an opening address by LINDEMANN CEO Carl Gustaf G√∂ransson, Past President of the Bureau of International Recycling,¬†Tom Bird, delivered a powerful keynote, emphasizing that while the industry is already green, it must do more to communicate its sustainability credentials. This set the stage for insightful presentations from LINDEMANN‚Äôs leadership team, outlining the company‚Äôs strategic vision, advancements in technology and a commitment to supporting customers with new business models and closer after-sales partnerships. üì£ü§ù

But CAB wasn‚Äôt just about presentations ‚Äî it was a collaborative platform where industry voices were heard. Lively discussions and interactive sessions captured key challenges and opportunities, ensuring that customer perspectives are at the heart of future innovations. Participants even got to go toe-to-toe with the professional table tennis athletes from the LINDEMANN-sponsored Borussia D√ºsseldorf e.V. team in Germany!

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the video to relive the energy, insights, and collaboration from Day 1!

The circular economy demands high performance and rapid, predictive recycling technologies to meet its ambitious goals. That‚Äôs where InDEx, LINDEMANN‚Äôs digital operating and production data acquisition system, comes in.

Developed to provide real-time insights into your machine‚Äôs performance, InDEx empowers operators to:

üìàMonitor utilization and performance instantly

üîç Track materials being processed

üì≤ Access critical data anytime, anywhere‚Äîvia mobile app or web portal

In a presentation at RWTH Aachen University, experts Wei Song, Fabian Diaz, and Bernd Friedrich recognized InDEx as a ‚Äústate-in-industry‚Äù solution, highlighting its role in supporting the circular economy through digital transformation.

InDEx gives our customers the tools they need to stay agile and efficient, making it easier than ever to optimize processes and maximize machine value. Together, we‚Äôre setting new standards in metal recycling technology.

Excellent Service for Customers Successüòéüí™CASE STUDY - EXCELLENT CUSTOMER-RELATIONSHIP AND CUSTOMER-SERVICE ACROSS CONTINENTS

Sometimes it's not the big strategies or long-term plans that make the difference - but quick, pragmatic solutions at critical moments.

One of our customers had a machine failure: A control block had unexpectedly failed after very long time of operation. Replacement? It had already been ordered before the failure, but was still in production for some time. Long story short: machine downtime and loss of production.

In this situation our service team deeply impressed me:
Instead of waiting, they checked with another long-standing customer, who they knew had a machine of the same type and a control block in stock.

The result? We picked this one up and sent it to another customer - a temporary loan of the control block across continents!

I have been working in various industries for over 15 years. But I've never experienced this kind of interaction between service and customers!

What can we learn from this?
‚úÖ Excellent service - does not just mean reacting to problems, but finding solutions where others only see obstacles.
‚úÖ Good customer relations - a genuine partnership-based exchange is what makes such solutions conceivable. Trust and long-term cooperation pay off - for all sides.

Have you ever experienced similarly situations? Even in other fields?CASE STUDY - EXCELLENT CUSTOMER-RELATIONSHIP AND CUSTOMER-SERVICE ACROSS CONTINENTS

Designed for ultimate operator comfort and precision, the LINDEMANN shredder cabin sets the standard for modern recycling equipment.

‚úÖ Climate Control: Equipped with heating and air-conditioning, the cabin provides optimal comfort in all weather conditions.

‚úÖ Enhanced Monitoring: An advanced graphic visualization system with Siemens TP series ensures seamless machine monitoring, so operators can stay in control.

‚úÖ Ergonomic Excellence: The rotating control chair, with adjustable length and height, features dampers for smoother operation. Separate replacement options for seat cushions, armrests, and headrests mean longer-lasting comfort.

Location Spotlight: San Antonio, Texas! üá∫üá∏

At LINDEMANN Metal Recycling, we take pride in being close to our customers, no matter where they are. Today, we're highlighting our North American headquarters in the vibrant city of San Antonio, Texas! ü§†

This dynamic hub is where¬†X¬†incredible team members come together to drive innovation and provide exceptional service. It‚Äôs also home to our U.S. service center, which ensures top-notch support for our North American customers. 

But what makes San Antonio so special?

üåµ Known as the "Alamo City", San Antonio boasts a rich history, with landmarks like the iconic Alamo and the San Antonio Missions, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

üåâ The city is famous for the beautiful River Walk, a network of scenic walkways along the San Antonio River filled with restaurants, shops, and cultural experiences.

üéâ San Antonio is also a hub for innovation and business, making it the perfect home for LINDEMANN‚Äôs commitment to advancing metal recycling technology in North America.

From this dynamic location, we work to deliver cutting-edge recycling solutions and industry-leading support to our customers across the continent.

It all began in¬†1913, when LINDEMANN launched its first baler press in D√ºsseldorf, Germany. What followed was more than a century of innovation, engineering excellence, and a growing global footprint.

One of the defining milestones came in¬†1958, when LINDEMANN delivered the¬†world‚Äôs first hydraulically operated scrap shear¬†‚Äì a 1,200-ton powerhouse ‚Äì to¬†Luria Brothers, then the largest scrap company in the United States.
Developed in cooperation with Lake Erie, a hydraulics company based in Buffalo, this groundbreaking machine marked the beginning of the hydraulic scrap shear era in North America. Many more followed, helping shape an entire industry.

Fast forward to the early¬†1980s, when the next chapter began:
The story of¬†Texas Shredder¬†took off in¬†San Antonio, Texas, starting with spare parts and consumables for shredders. By¬†1986, the first Texas Shredder was delivered to¬†Southern Iron & Metal¬†in Beaumont, TX. Since then,¬†nearly 120 shredders¬†have been built and installed‚Äîmost of them in North America‚Äîsolidifying the Texas Shredder name as a symbol of heavy-duty reliability.

Today, that legacy continues in products like the¬†TXS 69x90 modular shredder, combining decades of proven experience with the smart performance needed for tomorrow‚Äôs scrap processing.

From D√ºsseldorf to Texas ‚Äì and far beyond ‚Äì LINDEMANN continues to shape the future of metal recycling with deep roots, bold ideas, and strong customer partnerships.
